anime.description: After defeating his old enemy Ryuuga, Ginga emerged as the overall champion Battleblader. However, before he can even take a breather, a new rival in the person of Kadoya Masamune appears, challenging Ginga for his place as No. 1 Blader. Meanwhile, the WBBA-sponsored 1st World Tournament looms. Kyouya, Tsubasa, Kenta, Benkei and Yuu fight each other for placement as Japan`s representative. ~ translated and adapted from official site by Cranston

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

episode.title: 伝説を求めて
Seeking the Legend
Der legendäre Bey
Densetsu o Motomete
episode.summary: Ryo, Gingka’s father, acts as Director of the new WBBA but the first tournament is disrupted by a blader named Masamune. Gingka meanwhile is on a quest to replace Storm Pegasus with a Legendary Bey sealed in the mountains near Koma Village. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不屈の一角獣(チャレンジャー)
The Persistent Challenger
Der hartknäckige Herausforderer
Fukutsu no Challenger
episode.summary: Gingka defeats Masamune but Masamune challenges Gingka again and again, losing each time. Masumune trains hard and eventually manages to defeat Gingka, but Gingka learns a valuable lesson about how to work with Galaxy Pegasus. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たなる挑戦
A New Challenge
Eine neue Herausforderung
Arata Naru Chousen
episode.summary: New blader Mei-Mei invites Gingka into battle where she is partnered with Chiyun and Gingka is partnered with Masamune. Gingka and Masamune must learn to work together to defeat their opponents, and they do in the nick of time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 世界への切符
Ticket to the World
Ticket zur Weltmeisterschaft
Sekai e no Kippu
episode.summary: At a qualifying tournament to select representatives for the Beyblade World Championships, Gingka finds that he is already on the team and is not required to battle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! レオーネVSアクイラ
Final Battle! Leone VS Eagle
Ein erbittertes Duell
Kessen! Leone vs. Aquila
episode.summary: At a qualifying match for the final spot on Team Japan for the Beyblade World Championships, Kyoya and Rock Leone face off against Tsubasa and Earth Eagle. The battle is hard fought, but Kyoya emerges the victor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 翔[はばた]け, 世界へ!
Soar Into the World
Auf in die Welt
Habatake, Sekai e!
episode.summary: Since Kyoya has refused to join Team Japan for the Beyblade World Championships, a battle is arranged between Yu and Tsubasa to decide who will be the final Regular Member. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天空のベイ林寺(りんじ)
The Beylin Temple in the Sky
Masamune passt auf
Tenkuu no Beylin-ji
episode.summary: Team Japan arrives in China and is invited to their opponents’ practice facility, the Beylin Temple to observe their training rituals. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラチェルタの意地
Lacerta`s Will
Eine dunkle Macht
Lacerta no Iji
episode.summary: In a heated battle, Chiyun taunts Tsubasa relentlessly about his rigid battling style. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開幕! 世界大会
The World Championships Begin!
Die Weltmeisterschaften beginnen
Kaimaku! Sekai Taikai
episode.summary: After his loss to Chaoxin, Masamune begins hard bey training in the wilderness, where he meets a little old man. The mysterious old man repays a meal that Masamune gives him with some unique training that restores Masamune’s confidence. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 第三の男
The Third Man
Der Angeber
Daisan no Otoko
episode.summary: Madoka and Gingka visit the opposing team’s training camp to find out who the third blader is. Masamune stumbles on this third blader himself – “Chaoxin”, a flashy blader in it for the glory of his fans. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 四千年の奥義
The 4000 Year Old Secret
Das 4000 Jahre alte Geheimnis
Yonsen Nen no Ougi
episode.summary: The third and deciding battle of the first round of the Beyblade World Championships features Dashan against Gingka. Source: crunchyroll

How Grand! The Cage Match
Der Kampf im Käfig
Souzetsu! Kanaami Death Match!
episode.summary: Gingka and his team battle their next opponents in the Beyblade World Championships, the Russian Team, Lovushka. Masamune meanwhile is lost in the countryside, having been tricked into taking a different train than his teammates. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 極寒の地ロシア
The Wintry Land of Russia
Im frostigen Russland
Gokkan no Chi Russia
episode.summary: Gingka and the rest of Team Gangan Galaxy travel by train to Russia to meet their next opponents in the Beyblade World Championships. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勇者の名を持つベイ
The Bey with a Hero`s Name
Der Bey mit dem Namen eines Helden
Yuusha no Na o Motsu Bey
episode.summary: Gingka and the team travel abroad where they watch Team Desert Blaze do battle with Team Excalibur from the EU. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リブラ出陣!
Libra Departs for the Front!
Störwellen
Libra Shutsujin!
episode.summary: With Masamune still missing, Yu must take his place in the next battle against Aleksey. Anton and Aleksey have rigged the stadium to emit sound waves that disable Flame Libra’s Special Move, but Yu outsmarts them and claims victory for Team Gangan Galaxy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦士の祭典
The Festival of Warriors
Das Fest der Krieger
Senshi no Saiten
episode.summary: The bladers find themselves in Greece where they must battle the European Union, aka Team Excalibur. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再会! 王虎衆(ワンフージョン)
We Meet Again! Wang Hu Zhong
Teamwork
Saikai! Wang Hu Zhong
episode.summary: Gingka, Masamune, Tsubasa and Yu try to work on their teamwork skills, but end up quarrelling even more than usual. This leads to Madoka threatening to disband Team Gangan Galaxy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 灼熱の獅子
The Scorching Hot Lion
Der 24-Stunden-Kampf
Shakunetsu no Shishi
episode.summary: Kyoya travels to a country named Savannah to take part in a tournament that will allow him to attend the Beyblade World Championships if he finishes in the top three. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 衝撃のワイルドファング
The Shocking Wild Fang
Der neue Kyoya
Shougeki no Wild Fang

episode.title: 天空の神(ホルセウス)VS一角獣(ユニコルノ)
Horuseus VS Striker
Horuseus gegen Striker
Horuseus vs. Unicorno
episode.summary: The Beyblade World Championships have returned to Japan, where everyone is excited to watch Gingka battle Kyoya. However, when a restless Masamune challenges Nile, he finds that bravado does not always work, as Nile sends him down to defeat. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 永遠の好敵手(ライバル)
Eternal Rivals
Ewige Rivalen
Eien no Rival
episode.summary: The long awaited rematch between Gingka and Kyoya has finally arrived and their battle is of epic proportions. In the end, their skills are so evenly matched that the two rivals knock each other unconscious and both beys stop spinning simultaneously. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 崖っぷちの第三試合
The Third Match: On The Edge
Hart an der Grenze
Gakeppuchi no Daisan Shiai
episode.summary: The third and tie breaking match between Gangan Galaxy and Wild Fang takes the form of a team battle with Yu and Tsubasa facing Benkei and Damoure. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死闘の果て!
The End Of A Fierce Struggle!
Gemeinsam siegen
Shitou no Hate!
episode.summary: With Team Gangan Galaxy tied with Team Wild Fang, a fourth and final team battle is set to determine a winner. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忍びよる闇
The Creeping Darkness
Die schleichende Dunkelheit
Shinobiyoru Yami
episode.summary: Team Gangan Galaxy are in shock as they learn that their teammate Tsubasa has been infected by a dark power. Meanwhile, the first battle for a spot in the finals between Excalibur and Wang Hu Zhong is won by Wales and Sophie of the EU team. Source: crunchyroll

Die Rückkehr des Dragon Emperor

Licht und Dunkel

episode.summary: Tsubasa and Yu battle Wales and Sophie in the finals, with Tsubasa defeating both his own dark side and the opponents to claim victory. Gingka meanwhile receives valuable advice from Ryuga. Source: crunchyroll

Der Straßenkampf

episode.summary: Team Gangan Galaxy arrives in Brazil for the Finals of The Beyblade World Championships. Trouble ensues when Yu ventures off on his own to gather information about their opponents. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ブラジリアントラップ
The Brazilian Trap
Die brasilianische Falle
Brazilian Trap
